content: In this section, we compare several methods for transporting fossil fuels.
For overland transportation of oil, pipelines are generally the safest, cleanest, and cheapest [oil_spill] mode of transportation available.
Nevertheless, pipelines may spill more of the oil that they transport, relative to rail.

Transportation of Natural Gas
content: The two main methods of transporting natural gas are by pipeline and by shipping in the form of liquified natural gas (LNG). These methods consume energy, as a share of the gas being transported, as follows.
!Energy lost in transporting natural gas. Sources: Interstate Natural Gas Association of America [pipeline_efficiency] for pipelines, Nagi et al. [lng_efficiency] for LNG.
